project.teaser: Making Europe the first digitally led circular, climate-neutral and sustainable economy needs major changes across manufacturing: efficiencies in energy and material consumption, new solutions to problems in certification and standardisation, and upskilling of the European...
project.objective: Making Europe the first digitally led circular, climate-neutral and sustainable economy needs major changes across manufacturing: efficiencies in energy and material consumption, new solutions to problems in certification and standardisation, and upskilling of the European workforce. DILAPRO contributes to all of these, driving decarbonisation and the twin Green and Digital Transitions via two ground-breaking software tools for laser-based production of complex products. DILAFACT (Digital Laser Factory) is a sustainable and scalable platform for laser process planning via Digital Twins of laser-material interactions, including additive, subtractive, and thermal processes. DILACERT (Digital Laser Certification) tackles a major hurdle in rapidly-developing laser and additive manufacturing technologies: certification and standardisation. In the short DILACERT enables end users to easily process production data for certification; in the long term it paves the way for remote semiautomated digital certification of produced parts, a major paradigm shift in complex part production. DILAPRO grounds its development in specific materials (316L, IN718, IN625) and laser technologies (PBF-LB, DED-LB, and Laser Texturing) as deployed on 6 operational production lines owned by project partners. These will be developed as distinct modules during the first half of the project, and synthesised into DILAFACT and DILACERT in the project’s second half. To ensure the competitiveness and sustainability of European manufacturing in the long term, other developers and end-users will be able to contribute modules to both software, kick-started by DILAPRO’s living communities and innovative IP plan covering both commercial and OA licenses. DILAPRO offers two scalable, sustainability-focused solutions for the European laser-based, high-precision manufacturing industry, and will thus not simply develop a single one-off product, but a resilient force-multiplier for the long term.
project.title: DIgital LAser PROduction: Digital Twins of Laser Processing for Multi-Capability Manufacturing of Complex Components and Certification
project.keywords: Laser Processing, Digital Twins, Multi-Capability Manufacturing, Complex Components, Certification

article.title: Empowering Europe’s manufacturing by digitalising laser-based production

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Report.
result.description: A report on the current status of dissemination and communication activities outlining the progress, challenges and results obtained in the first 18 months.

result.title: Analysis of sensors and identification of technical solutions.
result.description: In the report, the best available technologies and commercially available products will be identified. Experiments will be done to help to find the optimal solutions, which could be achieved by the usage of a single type of technology or a combination of various technologies.

result.title: Advancing quality prediction in polymer PBF-LB: a hybrid AI and physics-guided approach

details.authors: Matteo Calaon, Hao-Ping Yeh, Shuo Shan, Jesper Henri Hattel, Yang Zhang, Hans Nørgaard Hansen

result.title: A comprehensive study of the effect of scanning strategy on IN939 fabricated by powder bed fusion-laser beam

details.authors: Merve Nur Doğu, Seren Ozer, Mustafa Alp Yalçın, Kemal Davut, Muhannad Ahmed Obeidi, Caner Simsir, Hengfeng Gu, Chong Teng, Dermot Brabazon
details.journalTitle: Journal of Materials Research and Technology

result.title: Report on defect detection and classification algorithm for PBF-LB.
result.description: A report detailing the defect detection approach for PBF-LB.

result.title: DMP: Data Management Plan.
result.description: A data management plan (DMP) will describe the details of handling the data generated during the project. It will be done in the best possible way to maximise the impact and will be inspired by the FAIR principles.

result.title: Methodology to measure the environmental impact described.
result.description: A description of the methods used and their application in the project in order to carry out both LCA and LCC analyses in the DILAPRO project.

result.title: Report on validated intelligent control system.
result.description: The report will describe the performance of a system to be evaluated based on the quality of the AM parts produced, and the ability of the system to identify and correct defects in real time.

result.title: Community Building Strategy.
result.description: The plan will include a description of:·mobilization of networks and associations. ·participation in external events and fairs.·knowledge transfer to the participants, ensuring skills development of the EU workforce while preparing them for the potential implementation and use of digital manufacturing technologies.·clustering and plan for co-organization of events with fellow EU projects and initiatives. Dedicated engagement actions and knowledge transfer activities to address networks; results and open data will be delivered to key European platforms. Furthermore, the generation of a project dedicated website will be described.

result.title: Commonly distributed & agreed audit procedure
result.description: "Develop an audit template for the demonstrator location audit with focus on “substitution” potentials of “digital quality control tools"" and methods ""data areas”."

result.title: Description of relevant and current software workflows for the respective use cases.
result.description: Mapping of the software architecture requirements as well as draft and create the architecture itself for the later implementation of DILAFACT.

result.title: Report on multi-purpose laser processing and production strategy-decision tool.
result.description: A description of a decision tool to help achieve the best utilization of the laser technologies compared to processing steps and costs (environmental and monetary).

result.title: Report on defect detection and classification algorithm for DED-LB.
result.description: A report detailing the defect detection approach for DED-LB.

result.title: Community Building Report.
result.description: A report detailing the progress towards building the LASER community including status, results, challenges and next steps.

result.title: Process strategy optimization framework description.
result.description: A detailed description of the work combining multiphysics models with data-based material models to create response models for process optimization and implementing them in production.

result.title: Eddy current testing and monitoring in metal additive manufacturing: A review

details.authors: Medad C.C. Monu, Josiah C. Chekotu, Dermot Brabazon

result.title: Validation and documentation.
result.description: Defining the initial DILACERT status quo assessment procedure based on ISO/ASTM AM standards TC 261 and all other AM relevant standards and standards related to digital monitoring.

result.title: Driving innovation in additive manufacturing: Enhancing efficiency and certification
Database for thermal effects on microstructure and mechanical properties of DILAFACT materials.
result.description: A databank (process parameters, microstructure, property) will be generated for each studied material, and their relationship will be analysed. These high-quality data will serve as input parameters for the Digital Twins.

result.title: Report on reduced order models for implementation in DILAFACT.
result.description: A detailed report on the obtained reduced order models for implementation in DILAFACT.

result.title: DEC Plan: Plan for Dissemination, Exploitation, and Communication.
result.description: The plan will build on activities outlined in section 2.2 of the project proposal Part B, including defining key messages and dissemination and communication actions as well as target audiences. It will also identify the KERs and the target stakeholders, as well as any IPR considerations.

result.title: Manual guides for the methodologies of physically simulating the AM process and laser-surface interaction.
result.description: Manual guides for reliable physical simulation of additive manufacturing process and laser-surface interaction will be created.

result.title: Report on defect detection and classification algorithm for laser surface modification.
result.description: A report detailing the defect detection approach for laser surface modification.

result.title: Certification analyses.
result.description: Mapping of the needs for digital certification based on the use case definition of Task 1.1. To use the use cases as demonstrators of a digital certification approach this report will define the requirements for approaching a certification task for each use case defined in Task 1.1.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
